intro: Dactylaena micrantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved papyrus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense spikes, typically in the summer months. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of rivers. Due to its ecological importance, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
